sn22.26:4.2: “Mendicants, before my awakening, when I was still not awake but intent on awakening, I thought:
sn22.26:4.3: ‘What’s the gratification, the drawback, and the escape when it comes to form …
sn22.26:4.9: ‘The pleasure and happiness that arise from form: this is its gratification.
sn22.26:4.10: That form is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
sn22.26:4.11: Removing and giving up desire and greed for form: this is its escape.
sn22.26:4.12: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling …
sn22.26:4.20: That consciousness is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
sn22.26:4.21: Removing and giving up desire and greed for consciousness: this is its escape.
sn22.26:5.1: As long as I didn’t truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
sn22.26:5.2: But when I did truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
sn22.26:5.4: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
sn22.26:5.5: ‘My freedom is unshakeable; this is my final birth; now there are no more future lives.’”
